How can I import a wallet using the JSON RPC call?

You can import a wallet using the JSON RPC call by sending a POST request to `http://127.0.0.1:27486/` with the following JSON data: `{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "importwallet", "params": ["path/to/exportdir/nameofbackup"] }`. You need to replace `myusername` with your actual username and `path/to/exportdir/nameofbackup` with the actual path to your wallet file.

importwallet "filename" Imports taddr keys from a wallet dump file (see dumpwallet). Arguments: 1. "filename"  (string, required) The wallet file Examples: Dump the wallet > verus dumpwallet "nameofbackup" Import the wallet > verus importwallet "path/to/exportdir/nameofbackup" Import using the json rpc call > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "importwallet", "params": ["path/to/exportdir/nameofbackup"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
